data.event: From the very early days of Northampton till 1847, the locality now called Florence was known as "Broughton's Meadow."
Soon after 1810 another name was applied commonly to this region, namely the "Warner School District."
The Northampton Association of Education and Industry was started in 1842, and while it existed, the common term given to the settlement was "The Community."

In 1848 these three names gave way to Bensonville, and when two years later Mr. Benson failed, and the old appellation became objectionable, the village was called Greenville, from the new cotton company.

event.title: two years later Mr. Benson failed

data.event: In 1848 these three names gave way to Bensonville, and when two years later Mr. Benson failed, and the old appellation became objectionable, the village was called Greenville, from the new cotton company.

event.title: fall of 1852 a meeting of the villagers was held

data.event: In the fall of 1852 a meeting of the villagers was held in the South schoolhouse to choose a name for the place.
